        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        }

        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          padding: 0.5em 16px;

        }

            padding: 0;

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1250701%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D3900" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1250701%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D3900%252526ust%25253D1703409721289343%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw2FQyQIJD0GhE56YaFgSR74%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        <div class="main-text">
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1250701: autofill silently fills in form fields hidden with CSS
          </h1>

        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)

      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<span class="line"><!---->If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Create an account, A, on<span class="line"><!---->1. Create an account, A, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>2. Create a second account, B, on<span class="line"><!---->2. Create a second account, B, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<!----></span><br>4. Ensure you are logged out.<span class="line"><!---->4. Ensure you are logged out.<!----></span><br>5. Go to<span class="line"><!---->5. Go to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a> and click "Sign in."<span class="line"><!----> and click "Sign in."<!----></span><br>6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<span class="line"><!---->6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<!----></span><br>7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<span class="line"><!---->7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<!----></span><br>  (see usps-login.png)<span class="line"><!---->  (see usps-login.png)<!----></span><br>8. Click “Sign in” button<span class="line"><!---->8. Click “Sign in” button<!----></span><br>9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<span class="line"><!---->9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<!----></span><br>10. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->10. Open developer tools<!----></span><br>11. Open the network tab<span class="line"><!---->11. Open the network tab<!----></span><br>12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<span class="line"><!---->12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<!----></span><br>13. Click “Verify” button<span class="line"><!---->13. Click “Verify” button<!----></span><br><br>ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<span class="line"><!---->You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<!----></span><br><br>EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<span class="line"><!---->The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<!----></span><br><br>This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<span class="line"><!---->This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<!----></span><br><br>I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<span class="line"><!---->I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<!----></span><br><br>NOTES<span class="line"><!---->NOTES<!----></span><br>USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<span class="line"><!---->USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain. Passing to autofill folks for further triage<span class="line"><!---->This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain. Passing to autofill folks for further triage<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 4<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1250701#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>

          Summary:<strong><!---->Summary:</strong>
          
          autofill silently fills in form fields hidden with CSS
          (was: Security: autofill silently fills in form fields hidden with CSS)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          OS-Windows
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>

      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        
          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

    <mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog id="update-issue-hotlists"></mr-update-issue-hotlists-dialog>
      
    <mr-issue-page><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;

        }

            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

          }

            height: auto;

          }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          </chops-button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>

        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)

        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<span class="line"><!---->If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Create an account, A, on<span class="line"><!---->1. Create an account, A, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>2. Create a second account, B, on<span class="line"><!---->2. Create a second account, B, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<!----></span><br>4. Ensure you are logged out.<span class="line"><!---->4. Ensure you are logged out.<!----></span><br>5. Go to<span class="line"><!---->5. Go to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a> and click "Sign in."<span class="line"><!----> and click "Sign in."<!----></span><br>6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<span class="line"><!---->6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<!----></span><br>7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<span class="line"><!---->7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<!----></span><br>  (see usps-login.png)<span class="line"><!---->  (see usps-login.png)<!----></span><br>8. Click “Sign in” button<span class="line"><!---->8. Click “Sign in” button<!----></span><br>9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<span class="line"><!---->9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<!----></span><br>10. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->10. Open developer tools<!----></span><br>11. Open the network tab<span class="line"><!---->11. Open the network tab<!----></span><br>12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<span class="line"><!---->12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<!----></span><br>13. Click “Verify” button<span class="line"><!---->13. Click “Verify” button<!----></span><br><br>ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<span class="line"><!---->You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<!----></span><br><br>EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<span class="line"><!---->The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<!----></span><br><br>This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<span class="line"><!---->This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<!----></span><br><br>I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<span class="line"><!---->I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<!----></span><br><br>NOTES<span class="line"><!---->NOTES<!----></span><br>USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<span class="line"><!---->USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain. Passing to autofill folks for further triage<span class="line"><!---->This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>

          Blocked on issues<span>Blocked on issues</span>
          
            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>
          <button aria-label="close">
            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<span class="line"><!---->If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Create an account, A, on<span class="line"><!---->1. Create an account, A, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>2. Create a second account, B, on<span class="line"><!---->2. Create a second account, B, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<!----></span><br>4. Ensure you are logged out.<span class="line"><!---->4. Ensure you are logged out.<!----></span><br>5. Go to<span class="line"><!---->5. Go to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a> and click "Sign in."<span class="line"><!----> and click "Sign in."<!----></span><br>6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<span class="line"><!---->6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<!----></span><br>7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<span class="line"><!---->7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<!----></span><br>  (see usps-login.png)<span class="line"><!---->  (see usps-login.png)<!----></span><br>8. Click “Sign in” button<span class="line"><!---->8. Click “Sign in” button<!----></span><br>9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<span class="line"><!---->9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<!----></span><br>10. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->10. Open developer tools<!----></span><br>11. Open the network tab<span class="line"><!---->11. Open the network tab<!----></span><br>12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<span class="line"><!---->12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<!----></span><br>13. Click “Verify” button<span class="line"><!---->13. Click “Verify” button<!----></span><br><br>ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<span class="line"><!---->You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<!----></span><br><br>EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<span class="line"><!---->The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<!----></span><br><br>This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<span class="line"><!---->This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<!----></span><br><br>I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<span class="line"><!---->I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<!----></span><br><br>NOTES<span class="line"><!---->NOTES<!----></span><br>USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<span class="line"><!---->USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Unconfirmed)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>

        AFAICT, the password manager autofill credentials on a specific domain. Reading this bug it seems that this behavior may not be conditioned on the visibility state of the fields.<span class="line"><!---->AFAICT, the password manager autofill credentials on a specific domain. Reading this bug it seems that this behavior may not be conditioned on the visibility state of the fields.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

      warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>
    <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

        Description #1 by pauls...@gmail.com (Sep 17, 2021)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<span class="line"><!---->If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Create an account, A, on<span class="line"><!---->1. Create an account, A, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>2. Create a second account, B, on<span class="line"><!---->2. Create a second account, B, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<!----></span><br>4. Ensure you are logged out.<span class="line"><!---->4. Ensure you are logged out.<!----></span><br>5. Go to<span class="line"><!---->5. Go to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a> and click "Sign in."<span class="line"><!----> and click "Sign in."<!----></span><br>6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<span class="line"><!---->6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<!----></span><br>7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<span class="line"><!---->7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<!----></span><br>  (see usps-login.png)<span class="line"><!---->  (see usps-login.png)<!----></span><br>8. Click “Sign in” button<span class="line"><!---->8. Click “Sign in” button<!----></span><br>9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<span class="line"><!---->9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<!----></span><br>10. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->10. Open developer tools<!----></span><br>11. Open the network tab<span class="line"><!---->11. Open the network tab<!----></span><br>12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<span class="line"><!---->12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<!----></span><br>13. Click “Verify” button<span class="line"><!---->13. Click “Verify” button<!----></span><br><br>ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<span class="line"><!---->You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<!----></span><br><br>EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<span class="line"><!---->The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<!----></span><br><br>This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<span class="line"><!---->This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<!----></span><br><br>I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<span class="line"><!---->I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<!----></span><br><br>NOTES<span class="line"><!---->NOTES<!----></span><br>USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<span class="line"><!---->USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain. Passing to autofill folks for further triage<span class="line"><!---->This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain.       warning<i class="warning-icon material-icons" icon="warning">warning</i>
      This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.<p>This issue has been migrated to Launch, see link in final comment below.</p>
    <mr-migrated-banner hidden=""></mr-migrated-banner>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<span class="line"><!---->If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Create an account, A, on<span class="line"><!---->1. Create an account, A, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>2. Create a second account, B, on<span class="line"><!---->2. Create a second account, B, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<!----></span><br>4. Ensure you are logged out.<span class="line"><!---->4. Ensure you are logged out.<!----></span><br>5. Go to<span class="line"><!---->5. Go to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a> and click "Sign in."<span class="line"><!----> and click "Sign in."<!----></span><br>6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<span class="line"><!---->6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<!----></span><br>7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<span class="line"><!---->7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<!----></span><br>  (see usps-login.png)<span class="line"><!---->  (see usps-login.png)<!----></span><br>8. Click “Sign in” button<span class="line"><!---->8. Click “Sign in” button<!----></span><br>9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<span class="line"><!---->9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<!----></span><br>10. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->10. Open developer tools<!----></span><br>11. Open the network tab<span class="line"><!---->11. Open the network tab<!----></span><br>12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<span class="line"><!---->12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<!----></span><br>13. Click “Verify” button<span class="line"><!---->13. Click “Verify” button<!----></span><br><br>ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<span class="line"><!---->You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<!----></span><br><br>EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<span class="line"><!---->The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<!----></span><br><br>This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<span class="line"><!---->This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<!----></span><br><br>I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<span class="line"><!---->I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<!----></span><br><br>NOTES<span class="line"><!---->NOTES<!----></span><br>USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<span class="line"><!---->USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This seems like a valid autofill bug, but not a security bug, since it only fills the passwords saved for that particular domain.       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<span class="line"><!---->If a site has a username and password fields hidden via CSS (display: none;), Chrome fills them without the user being aware.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 93.0.4577.82 stable<!----></span><br>Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: macOS 11.6 (20G165)<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>1. Create an account, A, on<span class="line"><!---->1. Create an account, A, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>2. Create a second account, B, on<span class="line"><!---->2. Create a second account, B, on<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a>. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<span class="line"><!---->. Ensure Chrome saves the username and password.<!----></span><br>3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<span class="line"><!---->3. Enable SMS-based 2FA for account B.<!----></span><br>4. Ensure you are logged out.<span class="line"><!---->4. Ensure you are logged out.<!----></span><br>5. Go to<span class="line"><!---->5. Go to<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>USPS.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://USPS.com"><!---->USPS.com<!----></a> and click "Sign in."<span class="line"><!----> and click "Sign in."<!----></span><br>6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<span class="line"><!---->6. Click in username field (to give it focus)<!----></span><br>7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<span class="line"><!---->7. Select username and password for __account B__ from Chrome autofill.<!----></span><br>  (see usps-login.png)<span class="line"><!---->  (see usps-login.png)<!----></span><br>8. Click “Sign in” button<span class="line"><!---->8. Click “Sign in” button<!----></span><br>9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<span class="line"><!---->9. On the next screen, enter 2FA code you have received via text message<!----></span><br>10. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->10. Open developer tools<!----></span><br>11. Open the network tab<span class="line"><!---->11. Open the network tab<!----></span><br>12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<span class="line"><!---->12. Ensure "preserve log" is checked<!----></span><br>13. Click “Verify” button<span class="line"><!---->13. Click “Verify” button<!----></span><br><br>ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->ACTUAL BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<span class="line"><!---->You will observe the username and password for account A were submitted, along with the 2FA code you entered.<!----></span><br><br>EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<span class="line"><!---->EXPECTED BEHAVIOR<!----></span><br>The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<span class="line"><!---->The 2FA code you entered, but no username or password.<!----></span><br><br>This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<span class="line"><!---->This is because elsewhere on the page, and hidden with CSS are input type=text and input type=password fields. (See hidden-div.png.)<!----></span><br><br>I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<span class="line"><!---->I would not expect Chrome to autofill fields that are not visible (and to do this without alerting the user).<!----></span><br><br>NOTES<span class="line"><!---->NOTES<!----></span><br>USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<span class="line"><!---->USPS is clearly also at fault here with bad site design/implementation, but Chrome should not allow/enable this kind of behaviour.<!----></span><br><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: Paul Schreiber<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
